intro: Physosiphon loddigesii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of moist environments. Physosiphon loddigesii is also known for its ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
